V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
2

R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(1) The licensee shall provide an orientation program for new
employees. Job shadowing shall not be the only form of
orientation.
New staff receive a comprehensive orientation though its documentation is difficult
to determine compliance. Multiple forms and face sheet were required to
determine compliance. It is recommended that each staff employee training
record contain one orientation sign-off sheet denoting the topics covered and
hours completed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There was one substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. Facility suspended and then terminated staff involved.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted five acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
SIR#2022C0219028 initiated on 04/22/2022 resulted in a corrective action plan
regarding fifteen minute bed checks. The CAP appears to have been successful
as no repeat citations are noted.
SIR#2022C0214026 intitated on 07/29/2022 resulted in a corrective action plan
regarding restraint technique. The CAP appears to have been successful as no
issue with identified staff have been reported.
SIR#2022C0217061 initiated on 10/19/2022 resulted in a corrective action plan
regarding behavior management pertaining to pushing and appropriate language.
The CAP appears to have been successful as no issue with identified staff have
been reported.
SIR#2023C0000024 intitated on 12/15/2022 resulted in a corrective action plan
regarding restraint technique. The CAP appears to have been successful as no
issue with identified staff have been reported.
SIR#2023C0000020 intitated on 12/27/2022 resulted in a corrective action plan
regarding physicial discipline and approipriate language. The CAP included the
termination of the employee and additional staff training occurred, as well as
continual updated behavior management training for all staff.

statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
